Investing Blog Roundup: John Rekenthaler Bids Farewell

I don’t think there’s anybody whom I can definitively say has taught me more about investing through their writing than John Rekenthaler. I feel like I’ve been reading his Morningstar column forever.

Rekenthaler just recently announced his retirement. And his parting article is exactly in keeping with his others: thoughtful, with practical applications.

  • Farewell, For Now from John Rekenthaler

Other Recommended Reading

  • The Big Holes In Your Financial Plan from Jim Dahle
  • Is the United States Going Broke? from Ben Carlson
  • A Rich Life Does Not Require Spending More Money from Harry Sit
  • The Heroes of My Life (Jim Dahle, describing his recent climbing accident and rescue)
  • Are We Finally Reaching Peak Awareness of Corporate Nonsense? from Katie Gatti Tassin
  • What Fed Rate Moves Mean for Your Finances from Tara Siegel Bernard and Ron Lieber (NYT)

Thanks for reading!
